Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alessio C
Reviews.Content: I use to go this Hotel quite often because I work close by to this Hotel, Comparing the price with the quality is simply GREAT! The people that works there are very friendly and always available to satisfy your requests. I would definetely suggest this Hotel to young couples ore business man. Just close to all major attractions, 10 to 20 minutes walking. There are some good restaurants in the area

Reviews.Title: “Waking up with the sound of coffee”
Reviews.Author: RuxandraA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Baltic is not the finest accommodation you're expecting to find, but it is very well positioned, you can walk to the city centre. Plus, the best thing for me was the sound of the coffee machine in the morning. That is the best morning alarm. And even if it is not the best hotel I've ever seen, there is a particular atmosphere that reminds you every second that you are in Rome and you are welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy and poor service”
Reviews.Author: JulietNW
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in 2010 but thought I should warn others of our stay! We traveled in a group of three, a couple and our friend. Booking was made together, however they split us up in to two different buildings with our friend in the main building and us round the corner. We asked if we could be in the same building, they said no which we accepted as they may have been full. However, our phone didn't work so we couldn't call her or reception from our room and had to use our mobiles or walk round to the main building. We informed reception twice during our sty and they did nothing about this. The room itself wasn't too bad although it was a strange shape and very small. The bathroom was tiny but nice, shower worked well, equipment seemed newish and was tiled all over. Our friend's room was also very small but her bathroom was terrible and she has problems with both her shower and hairdryer. Location was good and I know a few people haven't liked the view from the window of the extra building, which looked out on to a small (and dirty) courtyard but we actually thought that was the most interesting part of the hotel! I suppose this was because the rooms themselves weren't great. Noise was a massive problem at the hotel and this was in both buildings. Our friend could here the old rickety lift going all night and had people running up and down the corridors and walking in and out of reception... Walls were very thin! We had a similar problem in the building round the corner. It was very hard to sleep as the noise of the heavy front door could be heard clearly and it was incredible how well the sounds of footsteps and voices traveled so clearly. It sounded like there were people just outside our door constantly, which they weren't but it was just so loud! This made us feel a bit nervous at night as the building was mainly flats, seemed quite derelict and the front door was rarely shut. We didn't feel secure. There was only one night when we had to use the key to get in to the building (out of four days of going in and out). The other problem in our room at night was the light. It was fine when it was on so we didn't know there was a problem until we tried to sleep... As soon as you switched it off, it flashed! Impossible to sleep with a flashing light so we pulled out the electricity key by the front door so that we had no electricity at night. this meant we had to use the light from our phones if we needed to get up in the night. We informed reception of the problem. They seemed unsurprised and unapologetic but said they did say they would have someone look at it. They didn't in four days of us being there and even after we brought it up three times. Overall I would not recommend this hotel. It is only a 2* hotel, so of course this has to be kept in mind but the service was awful. There was no effort to improve our stay so we were very disappointed. If I go to Rome again I would avoid this hotel. I was happy with the location but in truth this was the only positive, oh apart from the coffee which was lovely in the morning (tea and juice were undrinkable!). Don't stay here unless they have drastically improved their customer service since our stay and you take a good pair of earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Never Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: mel s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. My partner and I likened it to a lower end youth hostel. The room was filthy. We arrived and our room had two seperate single beds in. We asked for them to be moved together. After our fourth night we gave up trying as they never changed the beds. Each night in Rome the weather was very hot. We asked for the air conditioning to be turned on and were told "yes it will be turned on". Obviously these people had no intention of ever turning it on as they never did but were quite happy to continually lie to us and tell us it was being looked at. When we tried to sleep at night it was far too hot with the windows shut so we had to open them and put up with extremely busy traffic ALL NIGHT. We also had mosquitos coming into the room biting us. The whole room smelt like cigarette, shower doors would not shut, bathroom flithy. Cleaners did pathertic job, were happy to take soaps but did not replace them. Our TV would not work. When we called reception we got nowhere so we physically went to reception to tell them. We got given two lots of batteries for the remotes and were told to 'fix it ourselves'. There are no power outlets to charge phones/batteries. The breakfast is a joke, it is a couple of crappy breadrolls and you are lucky to get a coffee. After two nights of this hell we went and stayed in a beautiful hotel next door "hotel Philosophy" and were treated like kings and queens. DO NOT STAY AT THE BALTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, but....”
Reviews.Author: vova l
Reviews.Content: We have spent in the hotel 4 nights during last September. The room was the smalest one that we ever been, but it held every necessary equipment. The staff (Rafael especcially) was very friendly and always was ready to assist. The shampoo was left from previous guests and during 5 days no additional shampoo was added, no soap as well. What was there from the first day - was till we left. Of course we could ask, but we managed without it. The location is good enough - 10 minutes to the Metropolitana. Nearest station is Piaza de Republica. There are several bars and good restaurants just nearby. Breakfast - continental, but very poor. Nevertheless - is enough to start the day. To submit all in all: good enough for being several days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quirky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: odette P
Reviews.Content: Arriving late morning on Friday after going up to the 3rd floor in the smallest lift i have ever been in , we were welcomed by a nice man who already had our room ready so we checked in to a twin room with bearly any room to move but it was clean and had a decent bathroom and a fridge and safe. plenty of wardrobe space. Beds were comfortable Breakfast was rolls , juice , tea or coffee efficiently served in a part of the reception . also very small. As we only slept and had breakfast for 3 nights it was perfectly adiquate. Fairly easy walking distance to most places . On our last day we left our bags in the room and picked them up later . What more could you want from a budget hotel ?

Reviews.Title: “BalticSucks”
Reviews.Author: miki6878
Reviews.Content: Baltic Sucks, rooms are filthy, bathroom shower is 2x2 a person just can stand in there, Room service - hmmm what room service, they did not change the bed sheets for all three days we were there, no additional soaps each day, if you need additional soap you need to go to the main office which is in an adjacent building, dont even think of having a break-fast there, the servers where eating and serving at the same time right in fron of us, A/C does not work so you have to have the windows open and its to loud outside for you to sleep. Staff is way too cheap, our room TV did not work for three days and they just gave same answere all three days that it works follow the instructions, TV had 8 buttons in total, how can someone go wrong on instructions. Basically it sucks to be there but we paid in advance so we had to be there for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “SCARY AND HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vacation1004
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and the experience there was scary and AWFUL! The room we were given was not in the actual hotel but down the road in some other random building which felt very unsafe to us. So to begin with, we felt mislead into believing we were paying to stay in the hotel itself when in fact our building very derelict, not like the pictures at all! There was a horrendous odour in our room that smelt like something had died in it and it was so strong we had trouble sleeping each night. Our window opened out to a very dodgy looking back yard/alley area so we did not feel able to leave windows open while we slept, which might have help air the room out. Our bed was dusty and we slept without blankets because they smelt so unclean and felt oily. To top it off, the cupboard for our clothes was broken and the table (with all our belongings on it) fell apart on us quite literally. We wanted to complain to the management but to be honest, they were so unfriendly when we first met them we did not feel comfortable confronting them. We also knew that it would be a nightmare trying to get a refund or asking for their help because of their careless attitudes, which was why we endured it. Please do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: MonsterBee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 2 nights. Though this hotel was conveniently located, the hotel had two seperate entrances which was kind of annoying becuase intuitively like all travelers we carried all our luggage to the 3rd floor of the first building where the reception desk is located ( w/o any luck of using the rickety elevator or any help from the bell desk as there isnt any). We were given a room in the other building so had to carry all our luggage to the othe part again without the help of any elevators/bell desk. The rooms in the other building were the smallest rooms one can think of with poor air conditioning facilities. We could not open the windows as the street was very very noisy. We must have called the reception desk at least 20 times but it was of no help. Also there is interent facilty only in the reception desk which the hotel is very miser about as they give you only 10-15 minutes access. The breakfast is surprisingly pretty good. Got upgraded to a new room in the main building the next day. The AC worked but the drains were clogged so could not take a shower. Overall a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “A trip back into the 1940's which I will NEVER take again”
Reviews.Author: BGIWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: I'm not a picky person, but I have standards. Standards of which this hotel doesn't even come close to meeting. There is a reason why this hotel is 2* and it will stay that way for a very long time. The website is filled with erroneous information, this hotel is NOT a simple walk away from Roma Termini. This is a major untruth! We took the metro to Castro Pretorio and we still had to walk 12 minutes to arrive at the hotel. The hotel shares the building with other offices on the ground floor. The hotel occupies the 1st to 5th floors of the building. The elevator was the first sign of many depressing things to come. This elevator was straight out of the 1940's. Controlled by weights, and no luggage is allowed inside. Reception is a small squeezed up area next to the dining area which was composed of 4 tables and 10 chairs. On arrival into the room, it was a double bed, when we specifically asked for a twin room. They sent someone an hour after to make the change. Their idea of a double bed is pushing two beds together with one sheet. The door to the balcony didn't close properly so we had to guard our valuables when we left. The safe didn't work either. The television never worked and reception seemed to have no clue how to get it to work. There is wireless internet available in the reception area, and I was told by the manager it can only be accessed between 1200hrs and 2100hrs. This I found to be quite absurd. I came in one evening at 2045hrs, and I went to reception to use the internet, and just after 9pm, the manager turned off the wireless router without asking me if I was finished. I have NEVER been to a hotel in my life, where this has happened. The elevator broke down with me in in one night as well, and it took me jumping up and down for 20 minutes to get it working again. The breakfast to my surprise was EXCELLENT. This is the only good thing I can comment on at this property. Next time I visit Rome, I will look into some other nicer places that are actually close to Termini, and not just state it on their website to scoop business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Anommis
Reviews.Content: We were a couple.Arrived at about 24:00. We met Rafael, very nice receptionist who greated us and helped us with a map, key and every thing we needed.The room was big (I was pretty surprised considering what I have read and heard about the 2 star hotels in Rome), plenty of space. (we asked for a new,renovated room when we made the reservations. still I didn't believe we will get one). The bathroom was a bit strange, still it served it's purpouse. We got the room made every day with new towels and toilet paper. The room window was facing a backyard but it didn't bother us much. It gave us quiet and not the noise of the street. The hotel is a bit far from all the main sites by walking. But if you use the Metro, you get there in 5 min. Still, we found about 5 restaurants nearby to eat and a big supermarket with resonable prices. We enjoyed our stay. Definetly will be back. (Ask for Rafael :-) )

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: aaronharnik
Reviews.Content: good price and decent location. The rooms in this hotel are the smallest i've ever seen. More like a closet than a room really. Staff was friendly and complimentary breakfast was good. would'nt really recommend this hotel, but if you do stay here get the upgraded rooms in the renovated part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, detached entrance from main lobby”
Reviews.Author: littledoo14
Reviews.Content: The location of the Baltic was decent - we were within 2 blocks from many restaurants (keep in mind most close during that mid-afternoon break). It's a good walk from the train station, but that's a major hub which was convenient. The lobby of the Baltic, same as where you have breakfast, was small - and in order to use wireless, you have to use your laptop there. We were surprised to have to go outside the building and around the corner to reach the separate entrance to our room. Inside the room however, was pretty nice - cozy and the bathroom was clean. It was a nice hotel to end with our European vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Place with good location”
Reviews.Author: Arash_Azizi
Reviews.Content: It was a very clean place with a botique atmosphere. a lift that reminds you of old movies (and it only gets up to 250 KG). Superb Breakfast which is included. Internet wasnt included in the room (you had to come to Reception area which is where I am typing from now!).

Reviews.Title: “No toilet in room and internet never worked”
Reviews.Author: ewill30
Reviews.Content: We got a room over the road and the noise was hard to get use to. The room was clean. But you had to go down the hall for the shared toilet. The internet never worked while we were there and if it did it can only be used in the lobby which is also the breakfast room. Breakfast was plain bread, coffee and orange juice. The front desk was rude and gave no help with tourist info. He just gave us a map of rome and showed us where we were on the map.

Reviews.Title: “It's O.K. for 3 days, but not next time”
Reviews.Author: Travelmanci
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel with my husband and 13 year-old-son. When we arrived late night (01.15 a.m) the doorman said our room not is that building, go to No. 95, lift up the 1st floor and there is the room. Very tired 3 people with big bags moving the another building in the middle of the nigt - that wasn' t pleasant. The room was clean, but our son didn't have own bed but I ordered a triple bed room. :-( No possibility change other room because the hotel was on full. The bathroom was tiny, but functionally and very cold and the hairdryer didn't worked. The surroundings was nice, a little noisy, but we lived in almost the centre of Rome. Breakfast was very continental and if you didn't ask for the orange juice didn't get it, but the espresso, capuccino and tea were delicious. No luggage room but we could left the bags at the reception desk, because our flight departed late night. Good public transport arround, metro 5 minutes (Opera) and could reach easily by walk Fontana di Trevi. Cheap hotel almost in the heart of Rome, but next time probably we choose another one.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Matthew303
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about the Hotel Baltic after reading some of the other reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. Four nights accommodation for myself and my wife was only 276 Euros. The reception is located on the second floor of an anonymous looking appartment block - at first I thought I'd gone to wrong address. I found the staff friendly and welcoming. Some rooms (including ours) are located in another building several doors down the street. The bedroom was adequate and clean, the bed was comfortable - with sheets and blankets rather than a duvet. The television in the room only showed Italian programmes. There was no heater in the (rather small) shower room / toilet, but there was a hair dryer. There was a safe in the room. The windows in the room were double glazed and appear to have been fairly recently installed, but didn't quite close properly and made the room slightly noisier than I would have liked, but it was far from intolerable. Best of all was the Italian breakfast - a very good cappucino, bread rolls and sweet pastries. Breakfast is served in the reception area - it is small and at busy times guests may have to wait to be served. All-in-all, it's not a very smart hotel, but it's characterful, very central, clean and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: RECYCLEONE
Reviews.Content: Did alot of research on hotels in Rome,wanted value for money,clean rooms and bathroom facilities and helpful staff and within reasonable distance of main attractions. We were not disappointed,yes its an old Hotel with an old lift,but that adds to its charm.We had 2 rooms on the same floor,one was larger than the other,but both with very comfortable beds and a small but very clean bathroom.Yes,there is sometimes a bit of a smell,but this is not all the time and you just need to open the window and it it is gone. The breakfast is continental,pastries, bread ,butter and jams and the area is small to eat it,but we never had any problem and they always accomodated the four of us on the same table.We never had to wait. It is about 10-15 mins walk away from the Termini and from there you can get to all parts of the city by bus or Metro.In fact 2 of our party left it a bit late to get back from Cavour and found the Metro closed and walked back to the Hotel in just over 30 mins.The area around the Hotel felt extremely safe,yes there are a few street people in the Temini area,but this is not any different to any other big City. If you want a Supermarket,you pass one on the way from the Termini to the Hotel.There are many little Restaurants around,good value and good choices of menu,just check them out.On our last night,one of our party had a few blisters on her feet,so we ate at ANDREAS,which is left out of the Hotel and then first left.We had the house RED wine for EURO6.50,with our meal and it was very good.We had paid alot more on earlier meals at different places,so it came as a pleasant surprise. If you want a meal at one of the Piazzas in the central area,pick wisely is all I can say.Check the menus and the prices,be warned. We had a fantastic time,seeing all the sites even though we had alot of rain.Bring your walking shoes and enjoy Rome. If you do not want a Luxury Hotel with all the trimmings and just want a good value Hotel to put your head down after a busy day,you will not go far wrong at The Baltic.

Reviews.Title: “Go with a sence of humor!!!! You will have a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: Davidsomerset
Reviews.Content: Our party, 2 couples. We had read some reports on The Baltic. We went may be expecting the worse. To start we thought maybe they were right. But with our expectations low, things picked up quickly. We were given clear instruction to our rooms. "back down the stairs, back onto street,turn right, round corner. second door. up stairs, buzzer at the door" we were let in. Clean sizable rooms, yes it was a little noisey at times, but so is our home! We enjoyed our stay. Having travelled a lot around Europe, staff generaly seem to be a little unfriendly, but ours were very helpful. If your expectations are low you will be pleasently surprised wiyh your stay. This is not a 5 star hotel. But play the "make the staff smile" game and you will enjoy yours too. 25 min walk to Trev' Fountain. Recomend it? YES>> take sence of humor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsLovett
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Balitc was an excellent budget option. The room was very clean and large. We booked a double - there was one twin bed and then two twin beds pushed together to make a double bed. I was traveling with a family member so when we arrived they separated the "double bed" and we had 3 twin beds. So I'm not sure if this is a standard double room or not but I thought the space was really large. We also had a nice balcony facing the main street. The bathroom was somewhat small, by american standards. The shower basically folded out into the bathroom area. It wasn't an issue for us but that might be somewhat cramped for a larger person. However there was also a shared bathroom in the hallway that I'm assuming could have been used if that was a problem. Breakfast was included and was a nice selection of pasteries, rolls, jams, etc. each day. There was also juice, coffee, cappuccino, etc. It is served in reception, which had plenty of tables and we never had problems finding a space. The location was great. Some other reviews had warned about staying near the Termini train station. I didn't find the neighborhood bad at all. If you live in a city or are comfortable in other major cities you have visited this should be fine. We walked around at night without any problems. Many sites were within walking distance (20 minute walk or so) and for those that are not it was nice to be near the train station. There were also plenty or restaurants nearby for dinner. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We were pretty much only at the hotel to sleep (and eat breakfast) so we didn't really require a lot from them. I thought they were very pleasant and attentive at breakfast though, which was mainly the only interaction we had. Our Italian was very limited but it was easy to communicate since they all spoke English. Overall I would definitely recommend the Hotel Baltic. It meet our expectations and then some. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “that is this place?!”
Reviews.Author: Mocreu
Reviews.Content: We needed more of a modest hotel in a central place in Rome, we facilitate the city. We looked for a clean environment, with breakfast and insurance. We come to this address, at night and frightened by the environment: the hotel operates in three different buildings, with apartments spread over the three buildings. We were a group of six people and reinforce the information the need to stay together, without success. One of the buildings in which operated the hotel did not have security in the door, the walls were dick and the general appearance of the building not inspired cleaning. The breakfast was summed bread, coffee, milk and jelly, and a juice from something that was called "orange".Only an official of about ten that I, we were sympathetic. In short: bad experience in a wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: TrainSailing
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is a great hotel which is let down by its staff. The hotel itself is great. It is relatively cheap for Rome, and while it is not as luxurious as other hotels, it is definitely worth its price. Good points include clean room and bathroom, air conditioning, TV, security safe and reasonable amount of space, although the bathroom is quite small (normal for you average en-suit really). It is walking distance to the Termini station, but not near enough for train noise to be a problem. Bad points: Number one is the grouchy staff. If this doesn't bother you, stay here, but if you like service with a smile you will be disappointed. To be honest I was disappointed by most staff in the whole city. The cheerfulness of Romans is grossly exaggerated, at least towards the end of the season. To enter the main hotel you have to be buzzed in twice, which wasn’t explained to us when we arrived, and some of the people on reception seemed really unwilling to let us in, as if it was a huge chore to press a button next to their desk. Reception and most of the rooms are up 2 flights of stairs, and the lift is very temperamental (we got stuck in it). Some issues other people have raised: Lack of restaurants in the area – between the Hotel and the Termini are at least 12 restaurants. Some of them are ridiculously expensive though. Noise – a couple of times other residents could be heard through the walls but no constant noise. Room 25 – we stayed in here too! I thought it was pretty nice, but I get the feeling the room had been repainted quite recently. The door handle was redundant but you could still open the door with the key and no-one could open the door from the outside without a key, so it was safe enough. Small dining room – this is fairly usual in family-run places throughout Europe, so I was not that surprised. How much room do you need to eat a croissant?

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at baltic!”
Reviews.Author: eliobarber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Baltic three days and at first when we checked in they took us walking to a nearby building around the corner, when you entered you feel like (because of the appearance, under repairs) getting into a third world neighborhood, but when you go upstairs to the rooms they are extremely clean, like new. They have air conditioning, which is very rare in europe. The shower was very tiny. So if you have some extra pound chances are that you won't fit in! They include breakfast, but the space to eat is very tiny too. Only for the price of 60 Euros a night was good enough!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, indifferent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ednaplate
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the top end of 20 Septembre near the Porta Pia and is easy enough to find as there is a sign opposite the hotel. The staff are either polite or just plain ignorant depending who is on duty. One of the guys on reception (glasses, balding, 50ish) was totally uninterested when we complained about something going missing from our room. They pretend not to speak English or understand but I'm pretty sure they do know enough. I noticed one of the other reviewers had Room 25 which was also our room. It was basic with a small toilet/wet room. My main gripe was the noise - there is so much of it. The walls seem to be be paper thin. You can hear everything and I mean everything! The reception/dining room are one and the same. On one occassion we left the 'do not disturb' tag on the door handle but this was ignored by the maid. Oh and the doors, what is going on with those door handles? Maybe it was just ours but it seemed redundant. I've stayed in far nicer hotels and do not consider this to be particularly good value for money. Cheap does not have to mean tatty. A lick of paint would go a long way. Courteous staff would be a bonus too. I think the equivalent of a one star hotel would be a tent in a field.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel - take ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Nando09
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day trip to Roma, fantastic City but disappointing hotel. We booked a room for 3 (no 25) which consisted of a big double bed and a pull out single bed. I suppose this would have sufficed had the bathroom not stank after a hot day and getting a decent nights sleep due to the constant banging of doors impossible. This isn't necessary the hotels fault but it is a major factor that would put me off staying again and stop me recommending to other travellers. Towels were changed on a daily basis. The breakfast is adequate (the usual continental) although a little off putting at first eating in the small reception area but we got by. The staff ranged from unhelpful to helpful depending on what day of the week you landed at reception! They kindly provided a packed breakfast on our last day due to an extremely early flight which we were grateful for. At £36 per night I'd say isn't value for money but Rome is extremely expensive to stay at, we stayed at the Madison last year for the same price and it was a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: fairylova
Reviews.Content: My travel companion and I checked in at the desk and were told we were actually in another building. The room size was comparable by European standards. The bathroom was small and the shower drain tended to be slow so the water was around the ankles during bathing. The neighborhood is pretty seedy, especially at night, but was about a 10-15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and Piazza Barbareni. The staff seemed uninformed with what was in the area, but through a little (daylight) exploring we found a grocery store, a laundromat and an internet place within a short walk. We didn't get the requested wake-up call, so if you need to catch a train, bring a back-up alarm as we thankfully did. Also our AC would not turn on so we were unable to block out any of the street or hallway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Depends”
Reviews.Author: shymike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Baltic for a week in Room 103 - was in the new part and the room was well decorated and very clean - the room was split into half so the bathroom was a v reasonable space and also v clean - but the room itself was v small with only a small space between the bed and the wall and the desk - i was glad i was not sharing it with anyone otherwise it would be a tight squeeze!! Noisy road but glazing cut out fair bit of noise but do take some earplugs - bed comfartable and slept well - breakfast ok - typical italian - a croissant, a pastry and hot drink - staff ok. It seems the room size varies a lot as does the ensuite so what you get is pretty much pot luck

Reviews.Title: “No Room For Us At The Baltic”
Reviews.Author: SamsonW
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay for 1 night in October (and on the surface we would probably say that it's good enough for a one night stop-over) however, we got lost walking to the hotel from the station when we arrived in Rome (totally our own fault). We were carrying some big bags as we were passing through on a holiday in Italy. After walking for 45 minutes, carrying the bags etc, we entered the hotel and looked forward to a rest for an hour before hitting the sights of Rome. We got into the reception to be told that they were overbooked and they had arranged a room for us at their other hotel - The Porta Pia which was 5 minutes walk. Actually - it was about 15 minute (also carrying a large bag didn't help). We were disappointed and the Porta Pia was ok but was basically a load of rooms in a block of flats with one level being the hotel. We complained to Hotels.com who managed to sort a small refund - so BIG THANKYOU to them.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Baltic”
Reviews.Author: Dalym
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Baltic. I appreciate that Rome is expensive but for £80 a room per night I would like to be able to sleep!! Firstly the hotel is based within an apartment block, so no proper front reception desk, the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything from doors sliding to full blown actual conversations, because it is based within a residential apartment block if you are below a resident that is noisy and playing music then you have no chance of sleep or relaxation! The room was extremely small and the bathroom you couldn't even swing a cat round it. The only postives are that the location was good and the room was clean. We had a fabulous time in Rome and I'm just glad that we were only at the Hotel Baltic for 3 nights. If you have no other option than to stay at the Baltic then take your ear plugs and be prepared to be bruised after walking into things as the room/bathroom is soooo small!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: milenkosev
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very convenient location. The rooms are clean, but very small. The bathroom was extremely small. We paid for bathroom and toilet in the room and had only shower. The toilet was outside of the room shared with some other rooms. The breakfast was ridiculous - one crroisant, some breath and butter. One coffee and something like orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “great stay baltic”
Reviews.Author: hmsdm
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed at the Baltic for 1 night. Hotel reception were very friendly on our arrival. Kids loved the old lift. We were then a bit surprised to be sent to another building further up the road and when we opened the door we were rather horrified by the entrance but please don't be put off, because you then enter another door where the rooms and the hall way were very well decorated. The room was small but we were impressed we were in a delux room which was above average for a 2 star. it was small but very nicely decorated and furnishing looked new including the bathroom it was imaculate. We had twin beds and the children shared a sofa bed which was much nicer than the standard camp beds you normally get in quad rooms. Breakfast is minimal. Highly recommended for a short stay. Rome was fantastic our children are 13 and 10 and really enjoyed it. Well worth a visit and stay at the Baltic its an impressive 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyguyNottingham
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just spent four wonderful nights at this bijou hotel. Everything is so compact from the quaint lift when you enter the building rising to the reception/bar cum breakfast room. On arrival the check in was dealt with in a pleasant manner we were led to our room on the same floor as the reception at the rear of the hotel. The room was adequate and clean, the bathroom was extreamly small but well planed with a hand basin, bidet and toilet and a quirky fold out shower cubicle all extreamly clean. the view from the bedroom window was great, we looked down into a typical Italian court yard. Towels and bed linnen were changed daily. Breakfast was what you would expext of a continental breakfast, croisant, roll and butter, juice and coffe or tea. The hotel is very well placed for the termini station and all other attractions. If your feeling a little tired of the walking the local taxis are cheap enough, from the hotel to the Vatican cost around 10 euro which is not bad for the distance you travel but of course a lot cheaper by bus or metro. I would recomend this value for money hotel to anyone and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: rachf
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Baltic in Rome although only a 2* was perfect. I went with 6 girlfriends aged 21/22 in July 2007. We paid £100each for 3 nights in 2 triple rooms so weren't really expecting a lot. We were all slightly worried about the hotel as had read some bad reviews but ignore them as this hotel was great. Location - it was about a 20/30min walk to the centre of town ie the Trevi fountain. We only walked it a couple of times though as it was VERY hot in July! It was really easy to get a bus into the centre/collosseo/vatican from just down the road for 1 euro per trip so we just did that most of the time, however the metro was also really easy to use. We were also slightly worried about safety but felt completely safe in the area, late at night we got a taxi home to be safe and due to the fact that the buses stop running at about midnight for about 15 euro for 6ppl. Thelocation was central enough and probably the most central you will get for the money. Hotel facilities - when we were in the hotel it was purely for sleeping and showering so for that purpose it was perfect. The only minor problem we had was that in 1 room the a/c wasn't really that cold but okay for us, you may have sruggled if you get really hot at night, and in the other room the a/c went off between 1-5am which was a bit bizzaire, but this didn't ruin it at all. The hotel was impeciably clean and the staff friendly enough. Breakfast was in the reception area and was small but we didn't have to wait once and we were a party of 6. They serve a basket of croissants, paistries and bread with jam, juice, tea, coffee or hot chocolate. This was a perfext start to the day. The staff were pleasant enough but not particularly helpful and not v good english. However, this didn't really bother us at all. I would definately recommend the Baltic to a friend for a city break to use as a base when exploring this amazing City. Feel free to contact me if you are thinking of going to Rome and in particular staying in the Baltic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: tititiBarna
Reviews.Content: We stayed last 19th till 23rd of July. It was surprising because of the bad reputation that used to have Roman Hospitality. The Baltic Hotel has a good service and fantastic rooms. Fantastic related with the low price they have. It is in a good location, close by Termini Station and Termas of Dioceclano. Then you can take the metro and some Bus. We will recomend everybody that place. And if we come back we will stay in Hotel Baltic.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend Baltic”
Reviews.Author: aris_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Baltic. I had reserved the cheapest single room, and got a very good and very clean room in the renovated part of the hotel. So very good value for the money. Not smaller rooms than normally in European cities and the traffic noise wasn't worse than normal in Rome I guess... Good bus connections to the historic centre. Breakfast was very standard continental. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A small and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: khberggren
Reviews.Content: A cosy, clean little hotel not too far from The Spanish steps and Fontana di Trevi. A friendly and helpful staff and the beds were exellent. Bring earplugs though. The traffic is rather heavy outside the windows. If we return, and we will, we want to stay in this place again. Kerstin Berggren, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER recommend this hotel to others!”
Reviews.Author: chezUk
Reviews.Content: Since it is only a two star hotel, I was expecting it to be small and basic. But the one thing that I couldn't put up with was the noise in the early morning. We got a twin bedroom right next to the reception (and breakfast area!), we were kept awake by a noisy group next door on the first night and got woken up very early in the morning ever since breakfast started running. The walls are so thin you can hear everything, and builders were working on the building early in the morning. So having a good night sleep is definitely out of the question..... and I thought all black and white TVs have already made their way to the museum, don't be surprise that you can still find them in this hotel! Some staff are ok and some are very bad.... I guess the only good thing about this hotel is it is reasonably clean. But don't go there please, unless you don't sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad!”
Reviews.Author: toerist
Reviews.Content: One can believe both good and bad reviews on this site; the Baltic is inconsistent and your reactions will depend on your expectations. Its advantage to us was that it was available and a good price for Rome. Location is OK, close to Termini and decent local facilities, but a bit of a haul if walking home from the Spanish Steps, Centro Istorico, etc.. The street is very noisy; hard to sleep with window open. Public Transit is good, but receptionist when we arrived gave us wrong info on the local bus and on where we could purchase tickets - was more interested in selling bus-tours. Breakfast arrangements, buzzing to get in, walking upstairs were all tolerable given the price. Rooms very small but tolerable; beds were comfortable. Bathrooms vary: they are very small conversions. In the first room we stayed in (#104) the bathroom was too small and shower water got on floor of whole bathroom; second room (#103) had much better bathroom, but its bigger size took away from the bedroom size.

Reviews.Title: “First night was horror, other 2 nights were ok.”
Reviews.Author: mikanmikan
Reviews.Content: We have booked 1 room for 3 nights. First night the hotel staff has offered us terrible room! The staff told us, the room has a little problem that they have reserved us. Then he has offerd us the old appartment on the corner. .The room was horror. We had to share a uncleaned bathroom with other guests! From 2nd night we had a normal cozy room. It was small, but very clean and fine. We hat a only 1 channnel on the TV. We could watch only 1 italian channel. The bathroom was extremely small and water didn't come smoothly. I feel that we have paid too much for that service and management. The appartment of the first night absolutely was not offerable. They should be shamed on this. The Hoel was surely overbooked.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, poor management”
Reviews.Author: BathBookClub
Reviews.Content: Seven of us booked on line and arrived on a Friday evening to find the rooms we had reserved and paid for upfront were not available. We were offered a small double bed for two friends to share or a grotty apartment around the corner. When we complained the member of staff present became aggressive and rude eventually suggesting that we should "sleep in the street". The Hotel had clearly double booked rooms and were either unable or not prepared to provide us with the accommodation we had booked and paid for. Due to the agressive nature of the staff member we accepted the rooms for that night and were eventually moved the following day. However the room we then had did not have a toilet and we had to cross a corridor to share one. A manager did not appear until two days later when we attempted to obtain a refund for the fact we had paid for a double room and were given a single. The manager was unhelpful would not refund the difference suggesting we had to recoup the cost from the booking agent. I would not recommend this Hotel it is too big a risk when you are only in Rome for a weekend and want to have a good time not this sort of abuse and hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Compact But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: My partner & I recently styed at this hotel on our month-long trip around Europe. Rome was not our first desination so we had a few sets of accommodation to base our opinion on when we arrived. We walked from the train station, but found the hotel easily - this probably took around 15 minutes, but we passed many useful places on the way, like corner stores (good for cheap alcohol), laundromats & internet cafes, so we knew the area would prove useful. On arrival we were checked into a room in the building next door. Once we worked out how the buzzer system worked (& that the promised 24 hour buzz-in was really 24 hours), we were all set. We stayed in a double room with ensuite & found it quite small but more than adequate for our needs, & definately comfortable. There was a TV & a small fridge, as well as a modern bathroom, with plenty of hot water & good pressure in the shower. In fact, the bathroom was almost bigger than the bedroom, but it suited our needs fine. We had large windows that opened out onto the street & let in a nice breeze. There was also air conditioning provided at no extra charge, which was awesome! Breakfast was available in the mornings in the main building/reception area. It consisted of cold & hot drinks (our chance to try a real esspresso), toast, roll & croissant (each), plus condiments. My partner is a large eater & found it perfectly adequate. The service was great & at times even quite amusing. While the location of the hotel was slightly out of the way of some of the main attractions, we walked a lot with no hassles, & also took the metro when we were tired of walking. It was well worth the money & we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: beadmeister
Reviews.Content: We paid for a superior room, which I think is worth doing considering the other reviews I have read. Air con was included and whilst the room was not huge, it certainly was not small. Breakfast was in the reception, in another building - really not a problem. Breakfast is basic, but this is to be expected in Italy. Not noisy, can close the shutters. Location not bad, could easily get a bus into the centre but don't think that this is the best location for a stay in Rome, better to be near the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain. There were some nice cheap restaurants near the hotel if you want to stay local in the evening. All in all would recommend this hotel, especially considering the competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelScrabble
Reviews.Content: We were concerned when we read reviews that the hotel was a dump, but this is not true at all. Please don't be put off! The hotel is basic but clean and in a good location close to the main train station and the main bus stops. It was also quiet and night and we always felt safe walking around there in the evenings. The staff are not over friendly but effecient and reception is staffed 24 hours a day. The room we stayed in was a twin which was small but more than adequate because we hardly spent any time there. We were worried that we would struggle without any air conditioning ( the temp was around 37 degrees in the day) but the room only had small windows so didn't let much heat in and for some reason on the last night the hotel let us use the air conditioning for free (usually in the basic rooms there is a supplement). There weren't enough tables in the breakfast room (which is also the reception) for everyone to dine at once, which may be an annoyance if you are in a hurry but we only had to wait once for breakfast and we waited about 10 minutes. Breakfast is a few simple rolls and pastries, juice and coffee or tea which is really all you want. Check out was at 11 and you could leave your bags in reception until you left Rome. If you planning on doing Rome on a budget, then the Hotel Baltic is ideal it's affordable compared to alot of the other hotels, clean and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A rip-off dump. Typical example of minimal conversion of a non-hotel building to cash in on Rome's heavy hotel prices. Reached via an unattractive busy traffic street. Split amongst two sites, meaning walking along street to get to breakfast. Rooms minute, approach and lifts dirty, dark and archaic. Breakfast minimal. Heavy traffic noise at night. Air conditioning not on (27C during day) and switching on was refused because 'it was only May'. Some good points: Rooms, although minute, were averagely well appointed (although TV is Italian only). Daily cleaning was faultless. Reasonably well positioned for Historic Centre walking. In retrospect, a few Euros more would have bought a far far higher standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean and quiet. The room was a bit on the small side but for the price it was great. The staff were brilliant and the whole place was clean. The bit that is the best is the location. 5 mins walk (or a short bus ride with stops less then 100 meters away from the hotel and a newsagent selling tickets {ps. service number 90 is the bus we used}) and your at Termini station which is the centre of Rome's fantastic public transport system. I would not hesitate in going back there.

Reviews.Title: “correct hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and me were there in april 22 for 5 nights, correct hotel,well situated and clean,staff helpful, price is ok if you campere wth other hotels outside rome, my be in summer it can be horrible because of no air conditionning! i advise to go from september to may hakim from paris

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked two superior double rooms 6months prior to our trip in October and received written confirmation. We arrived with this confirmation and were informed that no rooms were available until the next day. They found us two awful rooms in a very poor Pensione, while we were there we noted the price on the back of the doors were 90 & 46 euros. When we came to pay the bill they tried to charge us 135 euros per room for those rooms, after much argument, we still had to pay 75 euros per room for that night, for their mistake. Please note that in Hotel Baltic, The, Bar, Reception, & Breakfast area (5) tables are one and the same room, not practical at all. However rooms were clean. Will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, good location”
Reviews.Author: rad9378
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find in a great location very close to Metro and mainline station and only 10 minutes walk from central Rome. Close to shopping area on Via Nazionale and loads of restaurants within 5 minutes walk. Rooms are quite small and ours had no view at all, but very clean with comfortable beds. Rooms are in 2 separate blocks and on second floor no lift so beware but 24 hour reception good for late arrivals. Breakfast is very basic but perfectly OK and as much as one could expect for the bargain price. Staff very pleasant and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Baltic
HotelInfo.Address: Via 20 Settembre 89, 00187 Rome, Italy
